definitions.defn: prologue (to a major event, etc.); prelude

examples.chinese_phrase: 五四运动是中国新民主主义革命的序幕。
examples.pinyin: Wǔ-Sì Yùndòng shì Zhōngguó xīn mínzhǔzhǔyì gémìng dexùmù.
examples.english: The May 4th Movement was the prelude to China’s new-democratic revolution.

examples.chinese_phrase: 垂柳在微风中轻轻摇曳。
examples.pinyin: Chuíliǔ zài wēifēng zhōng qīngqīng yáoyè.
examples.english: The willow branches swayed gently in the breeze.
Our blood is boiling. or We are stirred up.

examples.chinese_phrase: 纵然成功的希望不大, 我们也要试试。
examples.pinyin: Zòngrán chénggōng de xīwàng bù dà, wǒmen yě yào shìshi.
examples.english: We will try even if there is little hope of success.

examples.chinese_phrase: 今天纵然有雨, 也不会很大。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān zòngrán yǒu yǔ, yě bù huì hěn dà.
examples.english: Even if it rains today, it won’t be heavy.
run rampant (or wild) for a time
